admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

0.cdata!:
Algerie - Projet d'irrigation du
            Bas Cheliff

abstracts.cdata!:
This is a Project completion report
            (PCR) of the Algeria Bas Cheliff Irrigation Project. The
            Project was the third cooperative effort by the Government
            of Algeria and the Bank to work in the agricultural sector
            and the first effort in the irrigation sub-sector. It was
            considered by the two parties as the preliminary phase for
            an anticipated wider Bank involvement in the irrigation
            sub-sector. Its objectives were to safeguard the
            continuation of irrigated agriculture in the Bas Cheliff
            district, to improve operation and maintenance of the
            existing systems, and to determine, through studies, the
            most viable follow-up irrigation development program in Bas
            Cheliff. At appraisal, the Project was intended to provide
            for rehabilitation of the irrigation head works by the
            replacement or repair of the head reach and main canal
            structures and the hydromechanical and electromechanical
            equipment, the purchase of operation and maintenance
            (O&M) equipment and the preparation of studies for
            follow-up irrigation development in Bas Cheliff.
